abstract: Polish officials report designer drugs, synthetic compounds copying effects of marijuana, cocaine and other illegal substances, are causing epidemic of poisonings, almost 1,000 in July and August alone; country, which banned sales of new psychoactive substances in 2010, attribute dramatic rise in poisonings to July change in legislation, which prompted pushers to unload large quantities of product at low prices; issue is global problem.
lead_paragraph: Poland has been at the forefront of combating “designer drugs,” but the industry is flourishing anyway, leading to nearly 1,000 poisonings this summer.

headline.main: Poisonings in Poland Illustrate Global Challenge of Synthetic Drugs
headline.print_headline: Nations Struggle to Stop Use of Synthetic Drugs

snippet: Poland has been at the forefront of combating “designer drugs,” but the industry is flourishing anyway, leading to nearly 1,000 poisonings this summer.
